Title: Letter from Abraham Garrison to Lydia Garrison, 1862 November 14
Subject - Topic: Soldiers--Family relationships--New York (State); Armies--Medical and sanitary affairs
Subject - Name [corporate]: United States. Army. New York Infantry Regiment, 161st (1862-1865)
Abstract (Description): Garrision writes to his wife, Lydia, and discusses camp life and sickness within the Union Army.
Biographical Information: Abraham Garrison was a private in the 161st New York Infantry Regiment, which was organized in October 1862. He spent the duration of his service in Louisiana and died of typhoid fever and dysentery on September 17, 1863.
